search_parameters.query: How to get free school meals

retrieved_content.content:
```html

Community Food Support Network

New case management system incoming

The Council will shortly be moving to a new software system for case management across Planning Development, Licensing and Environmental Health. As a result of this change, response times may be impacted between 31 July – 13 August 2025. Statutory timeframes will not be impacted.

Find out more about how this will impact the Planning Development and Environmental Health services.

Earlier waste collections during hot weather

PLEASE NOTE: Due to the current hot weather, please can all kerbside residual, recycling and garden waste bins be placed at the boundary of your property from 6:30am on your scheduled collection day until further notice.

There are a range of Food Support organisations throughout the Havant Borough, whether you are looking for a hot meal, a food bank referral or help with the cost of the weekly shop, this support hub should have the answers you need.

If you are a food support organisation and would like to be included, or have an update on the services you provide, please contact: askcommunity@havant.gov.uk

I need a hot meal today

If you are sleeping rough, or are at risk of becoming homeless, please contact StreetLink.

Emsworth Community Hub - Open 12pm - 4pm Monday to Friday for tea, coffee, rolls and cakes.

Emsworth Sports & Social Club, Emsworth, PO10 7JF

Facebook page: Emsworth Community Hub

Beacon Community Lunch Club - £4 for a two-course cooked meal. Every Monday from 11.45am to 1.15pm (except bank holidays). No booking required.

The Beacon, 69-73 Meridian Centre, Havant, PO9 1UN

Website: Beacon Community Lunch Club

Munch meals - Open for anyone to come to on Thursdays between 4pm and 5.30pm. You will receive a two-course hot meal and drink.

Munch Community Food Pantry, Park Community School, Middle Park Way, Havant PO9 4BU

Facebook page: Munch Community Food Pantry

FoodCycle Havant - Anyone can attend on Thursdays and enjoy a FREE hot meal. No need to book, just turn up at 6.30pm on the day!

St Joseph's Church, 134 West Street, Havant, Hampshire, PO9 1LP

Facebook page: FoodCycle Havant

Leigh Park Lunch Club - £5 for two courses with unlimited drinks. Fridays from 12:30pm. Booking is essential. Call to reserve a space - telephone: 02392 476382

Leigh Park Community Centre, Dunsbury Way, Havant PO9 5BG

Facebook page: Leigh Park Centre

Kid's Meal Offers

Sainsbury’s Café

You can get one children’s hot main meal or lunch bag for £1 with the purchase of an adult hot main meal from £5.20 in the Sainsbury's café. Available every day from 11.30am until the café closes - subject to availability. T's and C's apply.

Asda

Kids eat for £1 - all day, every day! Children under 16 only.

Morrisons

Children eat free all day, with the purchase of any adult meal over £5. You can either pick a free meal from the Café kids menu or a chilled kids snack pack.

I do not have a referral for food support yet

You do not need a referral to access food support from the below organisations. Community pantries and larders give you the option to pay a small fee to join, then buy weekly groceries at a reduced price.

Central Havant

Munch Community Food Pantry

Munch Community Food Pantry is open between 11am and 1.00pm on Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays, and on Wednesdays between 5pm and 7pm. It costs £5 to use and on average you will receive £15 worth of food.

Munch Community Food Pantry, Park Community School, Middle Park Way, Havant PO9 4BU.

The Peace Centre Havant

Referral and self-referral.

To request a food parcel or for further information, please contact: 07861 645343

The Peace Centre, 15 Middle Park Way, Havant, PO9 4AB.

Facebook page: The Peace Centre

Leigh Park

Leigh Park Food Bank

Open Mondays and Thursdays, 10am - 2pm.

To request a food parcel or for further information, please phone: 07935516529.

Leigh Park Community Centre, Dunsbury Way, Havant, PO9 5BG.

Facebook group: Leigh Park Food Bank

Waterlooville

Growing Places Community Pantry

Open Mondays 9am - 10am, Thursday's 9am - 10am and 6.30pm - 7.30pm, Saturdays 10am - 12pm.

The pantry offers store food staples to help make low cost healthy meals for the whole household.

Saturday includes a coffee morning social where the kettle is on for a chat, slice of cake and information sharing.

Growing Places Community Pantry, The Meadow Building, Growing Places Mill Hill, Mill Road, Waterlooville, PO7 7DB.

Facebook page: Community at Growing Places

Care and Share Food Bank

Collections arranged by appointment.

Please fill out a registration form and wait to be approved.

Care and Share Waterlooville Food Bank, Sacred Heart Church, PO7 7SR.

Facebook page: Care and Share Waterlooville Food Bank

Alfie's Arc

Collections or delivery at extra cost.

Please complete the form on the website.

Hayling Island

Hayling Island Community Centre Pantry

Tuesday 9am-1 pm, Wednesday 5-7pm, Thursday 9am-1pm, Friday 9am-1pm.

Fill out a registration form, wait to be approved, meet the friendly team & grab your weekly shop for just £6.

Pick up a membership request form from the pantry at the library or Hayling Island Community Centre.

Hayling Island Community Pantry, Hayling Library, Elm Grove, Hayling Island, PO11 9EE.

Facebook page: Hayling Island Community Centre Pantry

I need a referral for food support

These agencies can help you with a referral for food support. You can also contact your social worker, GP, children’s school, job centre or housing association to provide you with a referral to your local food bank.

Citizen’s Advice: Havant

08082787809

Monday – Friday from 10am - 3pm. Open the 1st Saturday of the month for drop-in clients.

Website: Citizens Advice Havant

Email: advice@citizensadvicehavant.org

Citizen’s Advice: Emsworth

Emsworth Baptist Church, North Street, Emsworth, PO10 7BY

1st and 3rd Thursday of the month only, 10am - 1pm.

Emsworth Baptist Church - Citizens Advice

Citizens Advice Havant – Waterlooville Library

Waterlooville Library, The Precinct, Waterlooville, PO7 7DT

Monday 10am - 2 pm (appointments), Wednesday 1 pm - 3pm (drop-in).

Waterlooville Library - Citizens Advice Havant

Havant Borough Council Housing Office

Public Service Plaza, Civic Centre Road, Havant, PO9 2AX.

Tel: 023 9244 6019

9am to 5pm, Monday to Friday

Housing | Havant Borough Council

... [Text truncated due to large volume, continue extracting similarly for other sections] ... ```

Reason.recommendation: Although the provided information about food banks and community pantries might be helpful, the content could benefit from explicitly stating whether these resources offer free school meals or referring to an appropriate authority (like local educational system) for additional information.
